title: TC001-Verify language switcher changes site locale correctly
description: Test that selecting a language from the language switcher updates the site's locale, loads content in the selected language, and updates routes accordingly.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Find and use the language switcher to select an alternate supported language (likely English)
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the language switcher button to open language options
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/section[2]/div[4]/div/div/div[2]/div/div[3]/div/div/div[2]/div[3]/div[5]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Language selection successful')).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The language switcher did not update the site locale, content did not load in the selected language, and routes were not updated accordingly as per the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

description: Check that robots.txt is dynamically generated and contains correct directives reflecting current SEO configuration.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Request /robots.txt from the site to verify its content
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/robots.txt', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Confirm that robots.txt is dynamically generated and reflects current SEO configuration
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/robots.txt', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Verify that robots.txt is dynamically generated by re-requesting and comparing or checking for dynamic content
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/robots.txt', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Request robots.txt again to check for dynamic content or timestamp changes
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/robots.txt', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=User-Agent: *').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Allow: /').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Disallow: /api/').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Disallow: /_next/').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Sitemap: https://oncait.com.ar/sitemap.xml').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC004-Contact form submission success and rate limiting
description: Test the contact form submission triggers email API call and enforces rate limiting to prevent abuse.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Contacto' link to navigate to the contact form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Contacto' link to navigate to the contact form.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div[2]/div/nav/div[5]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Search for or navigate to the actual contact form on the site.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # -> Look for any link, button, or navigation element that might lead to a contact form or open a contact form modal.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, -await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Solicitar asesoría' button to check if it opens a contact form.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div[2]/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Check if clicking 'Solicitar asesoría' (index 8) opens a contact form modal or navigates to a contact form page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Solicitar asesoría' button to check if it opens a contact form.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div[2]/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Email sent successfully!').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The contact form submission did not trigger the expected email API call or the rate limiting was not enforced as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Servicios' button to navigate to the service listing page and verify styling consistency
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Servicios' button to go to service listing page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div[2]/div/nav/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on 'Visitas a clientes' link in the dropdown to navigate to the service detail page and verify styling consistency
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Visitas a clientes' link in the Servicios dropdown to go to service detail page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div[2]/div/nav/div[2]/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on 'Privacidad' link in the footer to navigate to the legal pages and verify styling consistency
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Privacidad' link in the footer to go to legal pages
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/footer/div[2]/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Application error').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=A server-side exception has occurred while loading localhost.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=See the server logs for more information.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to URL with existing locale prefix to verify locale specific content loading.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/en', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Navigate to URL with unsupported locale prefix to verify middleware fallback behavior.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/xx', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=404').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=This page could not be found.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC013-Validate integration of contact form with Resend email API
description: Ensure that the backend API route correctly integrates with Resend email API and uses configured environment variables securely.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll to find the contact form and submit it with test input.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 600)
        

        # -> Scroll further down to locate the contact form for submission.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 800)
        

        # -> Scroll further down to locate the contact form for submission.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Click on 'Contacto' navigation link to navigate to contact page where form might be located.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Contacto' navigation link to go to contact page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div[2]/div/nav/div[5]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Navigate to backend API route or documentation to verify integration with Resend email API and environment variable usage.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/api/contact', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Submit a POST request to /api/contact with test email data to verify API forwards email request to Resend with proper parameters.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/api/contact', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Send a POST request to /api/contact with test email data to verify API forwards email request to Resend with proper parameters.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/api/contact', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Send a POST request to /api/contact with test email data to verify API forwards email request to Resend with proper parameters.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/api/contact', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Send a POST request to /api/contact with test email data to verify API forwards email request to Resend with proper parameters.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/api/contact', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=No page content provided for extraction.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
